How to Create a Control Panel All Tasks Shortcut in Windows 10 
 Home Random Browse Articles Notifications Add to This Page Add Tip Easy Ways to Help Approve Questions Review Tech Feedback Fix Spelling More Things to Try...   
 Log in / Sign up   
 Desktop Site   
 Community Tested How to Create a Control Panel All Tasks Shortcut in Windows 10   
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/50\/Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Intro.png\/459px-Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Intro.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/50\/Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Intro.png\/759px-Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Intro.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":278.65384615385,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":460.38461538462} 
 All Tasks is a window that lists every available Control Panel item. Creating a shortcut to access all tasks is extremely simple. 
 Steps Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3f\/Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-1.png\/460px-Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-1.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3f\/Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-1.png\/760px-Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-1.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":313.40659340659,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":517.8021978022} 
 1 
 Create a new shortcut. 
 Navigate to your desktop (press  ⊞  Win + D ) or  Open File Explorer  and navigate to a folder (e.g. Documents). 
 Right-click and hover over  New  and then choose  Shortcut . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c4\/Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-2.png\/460px-Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-2.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c4\/Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-2.png\/760px-Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-2.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":313.40659340659,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":517.8021978022} 
 2 
 Enter the following into the text box:   explorer.exe shell:::{ED7BA470-8E54-465E-825C-99712043E01C} 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/98\/Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-3.png\/460px-Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-3.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/98\/Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-3.png\/760px-Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-3.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":313.40659340659,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":517.8021978022} 
 3 
 Press the gray  Next  button. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d1\/Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-4.png\/460px-Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-4.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d1\/Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-4.png\/760px-Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-4.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":313.40659340659,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":517.8021978022} 
 4 
 Name the shortcut (such as "All Tasks").  Choose a name and enter it into the box under "Type a name for this shortcut:".
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3a\/Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-5.png\/460px-Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-5.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3a\/Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-5.png\/760px-Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-5.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":313.40659340659,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":517.8021978022} 
 5 
 Press  Finish  to save your shortcut. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/01\/Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-6.png\/460px-Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-6.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/01\/Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-6.png\/760px-Create-a-Control-Panel-All-Tasks-Shortcut-in-Windows-10-Step-6.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":313.40659340659,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":517.8021978022} 
 6 
 Done.  Launch the shortcut by double-clicking on it.

 Tips Edit 
 Change the icon by right-clicking and going to  Properties  >  Shortcut  >  Change Icon...  (bottom center button) and select a new .ICO icon. You can download a custom icon from the internet and use it by clicking or tapping  Browse... .
